content: sts for 18 row or about 3 5 inches from color change cut yarn thread through remaining live sts and pull closed weave loose end down side of tail darn any holes on body or bottom of tail 2 front legs make 2 the same the legs are worked flat with 2 dpns co 2 sts of color a onto 1 dpn row 1-6 k all sts cut yarn thread through live sts and pull closed weave loose down leg seam or hot glue half of leg to underside of the body and fold other half downward to support the front of body and head as pictured a word about the front legs they re wonky i m aware of that please consider them as you would an impressionist painting they are to give the impression of legs more than anything else although they will hold up the front of the body ears make 2 the same the ears are worked flat with 2 dpns co 4 sts of color a onto 1 dpn row 1 p all sts row 2 ssk k2tog 2 sts cut yarn thread through remaining live sts and pull closed weave loose end down side of ear ears should be folded in half to create a slight hollowing in the center and can be seamed to head or attached with hot glue color b can be embroidered inside of the hollowing if desired finishing embroider tiny nose with color b whiskers are optional and can be made with white sewing thread embroidery floss or artificial whiskers they can be sewn in place or secured with hot glue 3
